definition: to urge/to prompt/to spur on/to order sb about
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: Years ago, my curiosity asked me to invite him to my palace.
sentences.chinese: 我在好奇心的驱使下，邀请他到宫里来。

sentences.english: The problem with technological predictions is that they are almost always solution-driven.
sentences.chinese: 技术预测的问题在于，这种预测总是受解决方法驱使。

sentences.english: He is goal-oriented and driven by results.
sentences.chinese: 他专注目标，并受成果驱使。

sentences.english: Who has presided over an oil-driven bonanza for his country.
sentences.chinese: 他曾为自己的国家赢得了一笔受原油驱使的巨大财富。

sentences.english: Critics also say that the networks' advertising-driven business model is flawed.
sentences.chinese: 评论家也说网络的生意越来越受广告利润的驱使。

sentences.english: The current  occurrence of  torrent  spurs him to buy fur and  sulfur.
sentences.chinese: 现行的倾泻事件驱使他买毛皮衣服和硫磺。

sentences.english: Both drives him to become an extreme egoist.
sentences.chinese: 两者驱使他成为一个极端的利己主义者。

sentences.english: However, other interests drew British in the direction of the continental policy.
sentences.chinese: 然而，其他因素驱使英国把外交方向转向大陆政策。

sentences.english: This determination will put your subconscious to work and steer you towards success.
sentences.chinese: 这样的决心会使你的潜意识驱使着你向成功前进。

sentences.english: She was actuated by love for her mother.
He moves us and equips us to make a radical response.
sentences.chinese: 他驱使我们和装备我们做出彻底的回答。

sentences.english: Hunger goaded the boy onto steal the apple.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿驱使那个男孩去偷苹果。

sentences.english: The women who are not so charming, but are smart well-behaved women think we are only after our desire.
sentences.chinese: 面容平平但是聪明文雅的女孩认为我们为欲驱使。

sentences.english: Curiosity drove Wang Peng wei inside.
sentences.chinese: 王鹏伟受到好奇心的驱使，走了进去。

sentences.english: It is not part of scientific management to drive anyone.
sentences.chinese: 科学管理中并不包含驱使人们工作的成分。

definition: to urge (sb to do do sth)/to drive (sb to take an action)
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to long for/to crave for/to greatly desire
to move and appeal/to rally to a cause/to impel/to inspire
